intro: Ovidia anomala, commonly known as the narrowleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features small, white or purple flowers. Its leaves are narrow and pointed, and it produces small, round berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Ovidia anomala thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds.
